calibration_management_software.description: Software solutions for managing calibration assets, planning procedures, and ensuring compliance

products.description: Beamex CMX is an all-in-one calibration management solution designed to help organizations manage instrumentation assets safely and plan/execute calibrations efficiently, even in highly regulated industries. The software enables permanent storage of calibration results with full traceability history and supports compliance with regulatory requirements including 21 CFR Part 11.
features: Instrument management with hierarchical organization and predefined function templates
Role-based access control with authentication and user-group permissions
Reference management with calibration intervals and uncertainty specifications
Digital data flow integration with Beamex calibrators and bMobile application
Guided calibration process ensuring standardized execution
Uncertainty calculation for combined expanded uncertainty at each calibration point
Full calibration history with permanent data storage
Regulatory compliance tracking with change management
Patented Mobile Security Plus technology for offline data integrity
Work order automation via Beamex Business Bridge integration with ERP/CMMS systems
Maintenance inspection planning, scheduling, and digital documentation
Weighing instrument calibration based on EURAMET, OIML, and NIST standards
Data Loader tool for bulk instrument management
Extensive configurability including custom reports and certificates
Electronic signatures for data integrity
Automatic result validation workflows with email notifications
Single Sign-On (SSO) support using Microsoft Entra ID
Beamex Sync for asynchronous data exchange over internet

specifications.integration: Seamless communication with Beamex documenting calibrators and bMobile application

variants.CMX_Professional: Highly configurable solution with standard main features and optional advanced features; available as workstation or floating server installation
variants.CMX_Enterprise: All-in-one solution for large multi-site companies including all main and advanced features; floating server installation
variants.Cloud_Installation: CMX Professional or Enterprise deployable on Microsoft Azure for easier IT management and scalability

products.description: Beamex LOGiCAL is a subscription-based, cloud-hosted calibration management platform designed to help organizations digitalize and streamline their instrumentation calibration processes. The software enables users to manage calibration assets, plan procedures, execute guided calibrations, and generate compliance documentation through an integrated ecosystem.
features: Cloud-Based Infrastructure - Data stored securely in Microsoft Azure with automatic updates and no manual backups required
Instrument Management - Unlimited instrument database with hierarchical organization by plant structure
Reference Management - Automated tracking of calibration reference instruments with scheduled maintenance alerts
Guided Calibration Process - Standardized workflows ensuring consistent execution across teams
Digital Data Flow - Seamless integration with Beamex MC6/MC4/MC2 calibrators and bMobile application
Calibration Certificate Generation - Configurable, automated certificate creation with full historical records
Role-Based Access Control - Security model restricting user access by job role and facility location
Multi-Tenant Architecture - Supports unlimited simultaneous users and instruments at no additional cost
Data Analysis & Reporting - Comprehensive calibration history review and performance analytics
Offline Capability - Mobile solutions function offline with automatic synchronization when reconnected

specifications.security: CREST-certified continuous security testing; strong encryption protocols
specifications.mobile_integration: Compatible with Beamex bMobile application and documenting calibrators
specifications.data_protection: Industry-standard security practices with regular threat assessments

products.description: The CMX Analytics Dashboard is a visual analysis tool integrated with Beamex CMX Calibration Management Software. It transforms calibration data into actionable insights, enabling organizations to optimize calibration activities, improve productivity, and ensure regulatory compliance through comprehensive performance monitoring and predictive analytics.
features: Visual KPI Summary - Easy-to-use visual summary of key calibration performance indicators including failed calibrations, overdue calibrations, reference standards usage, and calibrator traceability
Workload Overview - Team workload analysis over time to predict resource needs and improve efficiency
Advanced History Trending - Device manufacturer and model maintenance history analysis enabling preventive maintenance decisions
Calibration History Analysis - Drift prediction and forecasting to potentially extend calibration intervals
Uncertainty Impact Visualization - Analysis showing how measurement uncertainty affects calibration pass/fail status and test uncertainty ratio (TUR) validation
Risk Prediction - Historical instrument behavior analysis to forecast failed calibration likelihood

specifications.integration: Integrated with Beamex CMX Calibration Management Software v2.17+
specifications.deployment: Cloud and on-premises deployment options available
specifications.compatibility: Compatible with leading maintenance systems (IBM Maximo, SAP, Infor EAM)

products.description: Beamex Business Bridge is a commercial, configurable off-the-shelf integration solution that connects Beamex CMX Calibration Management Software with maintenance management systems such as SAP or IBM Maximo. The platform enables automated digital data flow between calibration and asset management systems, eliminating manual data entry and reducing operational inefficiencies.
features: Automated Work Order Management - Calibration work orders automatically transfer from maintenance systems to CMX
Digital Data Flow - Eliminates paper-based processes and manual data entry
Bidirectional Communication - Results and acknowledgments automatically return to the maintenance system
Error Reduction - Minimizes human typing errors through single-source data entry
Data Integrity - Ensures traceable, reliable calibration data across systems
Compliance Support - Maintains complete digital audit trails for regulatory requirements
System Integration - Compatible with major CMMS platforms including SAP and IBM Maximo

field_calibration_equipment.description: Portable calibrators and accessories for field calibration of process instruments

products.product_name: Beamex MC6 Advanced Field Calibrator and Communicator
products.description: The MC6 is a high-accuracy field calibrator offering calibration capabilities for pressure, temperature, and various electrical signals. It functions as a multifunction calibrator and multi-bus field communicator for HART, FOUNDATION Fieldbus, and Profibus PA protocols. The device enables fully automated calibrations and digital data capture at the source, integrating with Beamex calibration management software for streamlined workflows.
features: Pressure measurement (internal/external modules)
Voltage measurement (±1 V and −1…60 VDC)
Current measurement (±100 mA)
Frequency measurement (0…50 kHz)
Pulse counting (0…10 Mpulse)
Switch state sensing
RTD and thermocouple measurement/simulation
Resistance measurement and simulation (0…4 kΩ)
Five operational modes: Meter, Calibrator, Documenting Calibrator, Data Logger, Fieldbus Communicator
Multi-bus field communicator (HART, FOUNDATION Fieldbus, Profibus PA simultaneously)
Automatic calibration capabilities
Built-in 24 VDC loop supply
Step-by-step guided calibration process
Error calculation and pass/fail analysis
Digital documentation without manual entry
5.7" touchscreen display (640 x 480 TFT LCD)
Multilingual interface
Operable with bare fingers or gloved hands
IP65 rating (water and dust-proof)
Lightweight and ergonomic
Rechargeable lithium-ion battery (10-16 hours operation)
Integration with LOGiCAL and CMX software
Wireless Bluetooth communication capability

specifications.operational_modes: Meter, Calibrator, Documenting Calibrator, Data Logger, Fieldbus Communicator

products.product_name: Beamex MC6-Ex Intrinsically Safe Advanced Field Calibrator and Communicator
products.description: The MC6-Ex is an ATEX, IECEx, and North American-certified intrinsically safe field calibrator designed for use in hazardous areas. It combines multifunction calibration capabilities with fieldbus communication in a single portable device, eliminating the need for hot work permits and gas detectors when operating in potentially explosive environments.
features: Intrinsic Safety Certification - ATEX, IECEx, and North American certified for Zones 0, 1, 2 and Divisions 1, 2
Multifunction Capabilities - Pressure, temperature, and electrical signal calibration
Field Communicator - Multi-bus support for HART, FOUNDATION Fieldbus, and Profibus PA protocols
Five Operational Modes - Meter, Calibrator, Documenting Calibrator, Data Logger, and Fieldbus Communicator
High Accuracy - Traceable, accredited calibration certificates included
Robust Design - IP65-rated, dust and waterproof with integrated impact protectors
Large Touchscreen - 5.7" multilingual display usable with bare hands or gloves
Field-Replaceable Battery - Smart NiMh pack with 4-8 hour operation
Digital Integration - Communicates with Beamex LOGiCAL and CMX calibration management software
Automatic Documentation - Captures calibration data without manual entry
Internal Loop Supply - For transmitter calibration without external equipment

specifications.dimensions: 207 x 231 x 80 mm (D x W x H)
specifications.certifications: ATEX, IECEx, North American (Zones 0, 1, 2 and Divisions 1, 2)

products.product_name: Beamex MC6-T Multifunction Temperature Calibrator and Communicator
products.description: The MC6-T combines an advanced temperature dry block with integrated multifunction process calibrator and communicator technology. It offers versatility for temperature, pressure, and electrical signal calibrations, plus multi-bus communicator functionality for fieldbus instruments. The device is designed for industrial environments with patented temperature control algorithms and multiple safety features.
features: Temperature Generation & Control - Range from -30 to 150°C (MC6-T150) or 50 to 660°C (MC6-T660)
Active Multizone Temperature Control - Triple/dual zone technology with excellent temperature gradient
Multifunction Capabilities - Temperature, pressure, and electrical signal calibration in one device
Field Communicator - HART, FOUNDATION Fieldbus, and Profibus PA protocols (all three simultaneously enabled)
Documenting Calibrator - Digital data capture and integration with calibration management software
Group Calibration - Automatic calibration of multiple temperature instruments simultaneously
Battery Operation - Rechargeable lithium-ion, 10-16 hours runtime (most functions except temperature control)
Multiple User Interface Modes - Temperature Calibrator, Documenting Calibrator, Calibrator, Data Logger, and Communicator modes
Safety Features - Tilt sensor, warning light, standalone overheat protection
Sanitary Sensor Capability - Designed to calibrate short and sanitary sensors

products.description: An intuitive, multi-platform mobile solution designed for field technicians to execute and document calibrations offline. The application integrates with Beamex CMX or LOGiCAL calibration management software, guiding users through pre-configured calibration procedures step-by-step.
features: Guided Calibration Execution - Step-by-step procedures for any process instrument type
Paperless Documentation - Eliminates manual pen-and-paper recording
Automatic Calculations - Performs error calculations and pass/fail analysis automatically
Maintenance Inspections - Create and execute inspection checklists with CMX
Weighing Instrument Calibrations - Supports EURAMET, OIML, and NIST standards
Data Integrity Protection - Mobile Security Plus technology for offline data security
Multi-Platform Support - Available on iOS, Android, and Windows
Offline Capability - Stores results securely when internet unavailable
Electronic Signatures - Optional security features for regulated industries
Flexible Instrument Management - Create/edit instruments on-the-fly with LOGiCAL

specifications.distribution: Free download from App Store, Google Play, Beamex Download Center
specifications.integration: Works with CMX and LOGiCAL software
specifications.data_transfer: Syncs results back to calibration management system

products.product_name: Beamex ePG Electric Pressure Pump and Controller
products.description: The Beamex ePG is a portable, battery-operated electric pressure generation device designed for industrial pressure calibration applications. It operates across a pressure range from -0.85 to 20 bar (-12.4 to 300 psi) and functions as a standalone unit compatible with any existing pressure calibrator. The device eliminates the need for manual hand pumps by enabling pressure generation with the push of a button.
features: Effortless pressure generation via coarse and fine adjustment buttons
Flexible compatibility with any pressure calibrator (no need to purchase new equipment)
User-serviceable design with common maintenance tasks performable by operators
Field-replaceable Li-ion battery with extended operation time (over one week typical use)
Automatic communication capability with Beamex MC6 family calibrators for fully automated pressure calibrations
Water and dust resistant construction for field durability
One-handed operation with shoulder strap for portability
Backlit controls for visibility in various lighting conditions
Sustainable design allowing firmware updates and easy spare parts replacement

specifications.wetted_materials: Aluminum, brass, stainless steel, thermoplastic polyester, food-grade LMS oil

products.description: Beamex offers a comprehensive range of hand-operated calibration pumps designed for pressure calibration across various industrial applications. These pumps enable technicians to generate precise reference pressures for calibrating pressure instruments in process industries.
features: Hand-operated design for field portability
Multiple pressure range options
Fine-tuning adjustment capabilities
Durable construction for industrial use
Compatible with Beamex MC6 family calibrators

products.description: Beamex offers a comprehensive range of temperature reference sensors designed for industrial calibration applications. These sensors serve as precision measurement tools for validating temperature instrumentation across various industries and operational environments.
features: RPRT - Very accurate and extremely stable sensor for demanding calibrations with stability up to ±0.007 °C
RPRT - Available in straight and 90° bent configurations
RPRT - Integrated memory storing sensor coefficients
RPRT - Lemo connector compatible with Beamex MC6 family calibrators
IPRT-300 - Robust general-purpose Pt100 sensor with accuracy of ±0.04 °C when using correction coefficients
IPRT-300 - Better than 1/3 DIN accuracy without coefficients
IPRT-300 - IEC60751 Pt100 (385) standard compliant
SIRT-155 - Optimized for short and flanged sanitary sensor calibration
SIRT-155 - Very short and thin design with thin cable
SIRT-155 - IEC60751 Class A Pt100 sensor

products.description: The Beamex FB is a portable temperature calibration device designed for industrial field applications. It functions as a dry block calibrator that enables technicians to perform temperature calibrations on-site with laboratory-grade accuracy. The device weighs approximately 8 kg and is compact enough for field portability.
features: Portability - Lightweight at ~8 kg with small, carry-friendly design
Speed - Rapid temperature transitions: cools to –25°C in 15 minutes, heats to +660°C in 15 minutes
Accuracy - Display accuracy up to ±0.2°C with control stability of ±0.01°C
Uniformity - Dual zone-controlled block with axial uniformity ±0.04°C and radial uniformity ±0.01°C
Smart Reference Sensors - Internal reference thermometer (R models) compatible with Beamex smart reference sensors featuring plug-and-play memory
User Interface - Large LCD display, multilingual menu-based interface, graphic and audible stability indicators
Safety Features - HOT warning light for temperatures exceeding +50°C
Communication - Port enabling integration with Beamex MC calibrators for automated calibration and documentation
Certification - Delivered with accredited calibration certificate

products.description: The Beamex MB is a portable temperature dry block calibrator engineered to deliver laboratory-grade accuracy in a field-deployable format. It functions as a stable heat source suitable for both laboratory and field environments, enabling users to conduct high-precision temperature calibrations without requiring separate reference equipment in many applications.
features: High Accuracy & Stability - Internal temperature measurement with display accuracy up to ±0.1°C and exceptional stability of ±0.005°C
Built-in Reference Input - Optional external reference sensor connection (R models) with measurement accuracy to ±0.006°C
Axial Uniformity - Dual zone control technology providing uniformity to ±0.02°C
Extended Immersion Depth - Up to 203mm (160mm for MB140) reducing stem conduction errors
Loading Compensation - Specifications to ±0.005°C with dual zone control
MC Calibrator Communication - Compatible with Beamex MC6 calibrators for automated calibration and documentation
ITS-90 Compensation - Supports ITS-90 or CVD coefficients for sensor error correction
Portable Design - Bath-level accuracy in a convenient, transportable dry block format

products.description: The Beamex EXT range comprises external pressure modules designed to expand calibration capabilities. These devices increase configuration possibilities and add flexibility, making it possible to calibrate even more pressure ranges with the same calibrator.
features: High-accuracy pressure measurement modules
Wide pressure range coverage: vacuum to 1,000 bar (14,500 psi)
Compatible with Beamex MC family calibrators
Two variants available: EXT (Standard) and EXT-IS (Intrinsically safe for hazardous environments)
Enables multi-range calibration with single calibrator

workshop_calibration.description: Workshop and laboratory calibration solutions for comprehensive instrument maintenance

products.description: The CENTRiCAL is a modular workshop calibration system designed for the process industries. It represents decades of experience providing world-class solutions and combines ease of use, versatility, and ergonomic design. The solution enables efficient maintenance of process instruments including transmitters, converters, temperature probes, recorders, and indicators in workshop and laboratory environments.
features: Modular Design - Configurable according to specific needs with ability to add or replace modules
Ergonomic - Electronically adjustable bench height for maximum comfort
ESD Protected - All components protected against electrostatic discharge
Pre-Calibrated - Delivered with calibration certificates for immediate use
Digital Integration - Connects with Beamex calibration management software (LOGiCAL/CMX)
High Accuracy - Provides accurate measurements with low calibration uncertainty
Automated Documentation - MC6-WS calibrator documents calibrations digitally without manual entry
Multiple Configuration Options - Available as bench, trolley, or tabletop solution
Sustainable Design - Modular construction supports long-term use and upgrades

form_factors: Calibration trolley (with wheels and lockable drawer)

specifications.optional_components: AC/DC power supplies, multimeters, soldering stations, oscilloscopes, function generators

It serves as the core component of the Beamex CENTRiCAL workshop calibration solution, enabling automated calibrations with digital data capture and secure result storage across pressure, temperature, and electrical signal measurements.

5.7" touchscreen display (640 x 480 TFT LCD)
Multiple language support
Step-by-step guidance

Dual simultaneous measurement channels (resistance, RTD, thermocouple)
Data logging capability (up to nine simultaneous measurements)
Traceable accredited calibration certificate included

products.description: The POC8 is an accurate and user-friendly automatic pressure output controller designed for workshop and desktop calibration applications. It provides regulated pressure output ranging from vacuum to 210 bar (3045 psi). The device integrates with Beamex's calibration ecosystem, including MC6 family calibrators and calibration management software, to create a comprehensive automated pressure calibration solution.
features: Automatic pressure calibration capability
7-inch color LCD touchscreen display
Multi-language user interface (10+ languages)
Vacuum to 210 bar (3045 psi) pressure range
Integration with Beamex CENTRiCAL workshop calibration bench
Standalone desktop version available
Compatible with Beamex MC6 calibrators
Integrates with Beamex calibration software for documentation and management
